newsitem.title: USA: UPS says will not change offer to Teamsters.
newsitem.headline: UPS says will not change offer to Teamsters.

text.p: United Parcel Service negotiators met for more than two hours with Labour Secretary Alexis Herman on Monday to try to end an 8-day-old strike by the Teamsters union but said the company would not improve its contract offer.

"We're pleased that Secretary of Labour Herman has taken a personal interest in our problems," negotiator Dave Murray told reporters after meeting with Herman. "However, we still believe that the correct solution to this is for the Teamsters to put our people back to work and send our offer out for a vote."
Murray met with Herman in her office at the Labour Department. He declined to take questions after giving his brief statement to reporters waiting outside.
Earlier, Herman met with Teamsters President Ron Carey. After that meeting, Carey said he would be willing to resume talks with the company.
Herman requested the meetings after talks between the parties broke down on Saturday despite the assistance of a federal mediator.
Over the weekend, Carey had said that further talks would be fruitless because the company had been unwilling to alter its "last, best and final" offer.
